reg:regulation.reg:title:
McLeod Lake Indian Band Treaty No. 8
Adhesion and Settlement Agreement
Exemption Regulation
reg:regulation.reg:amsincluded: [includes amendments up to B.C. Reg. 106/2006, April 27, 2006]

bcl:section.bcl:text: In this regulation, MLIB Agreement means the McLeod Lake Indian Band Treaty No. 8 Adhesion and Settlement Agreement entered into by the McLeod Lake Indian Band, Her Majesty the Queen in right of Canada and Her Majesty the Queen in right of British Columbia.

A Crown grant that, in fulfilment of article 8.5 of the MLIB Agreement, conveys land from the government of British Columbia to a member of the McLeod Lake Indian Band, or to the legal representative of a member of the McLeod Lake Indian Band on the member's behalf, is a taxable transaction exempt from tax under the Property Transfer Tax Act.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Exemption — transfer from legal representative to member
bcl:section.bcl:text: If land was conveyed under a Crown grant referred to in section 2 to the legal representative of a member of the McLeod Lake Indian Band on the member's behalf, the transfer of that land from the legal representative of the member to that member is a taxable transaction exempt from tax under the Property Transfer Tax Act.

reg:content.reg:provisionsnote: [Provisions of the Property Transfer Tax Act, R.S.B.C. 1996, c. 378, relevant to the enactment of this regulation: section 37 (2) (b)]
